intro: Alectorolophus arvernensis, commonly known as the Arverne bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the region of Auvergne in France. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone-rich soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. It is a perennial herb with slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and protected species in its native region.
